text.para: Strings in python are surrounded by either single quotation marks, or double quotation marks.'hello' is the same as "hello".You can display a string literal with the print() function

list.item: Assigning a string to a variable is done with the variable name followed by an equal sign and the string
You can assign a multiline string to a variable by using three quotes

editor.title: Example
editor.syntax: a = "Hello" print(a) b = """Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.""" print(b)
